abstract: Just when Jack Flack thought John A. Thain was going to go down as the best-scrubbed, crisply parted scapegoat in the history of Wall Street, the Mechanical One stood up for himself. The move was wise. If Kenneth D. Lewis also crashes at Bank of America, Mr. Thain’s legacy will very likely be upgraded to that of a tone-deaf bot who was caught up in another one of those big, complicated financial messes that nobody really understands.
lead_paragraph: Just when Jack Flack thought John A. Thain was going to go down as the best-scrubbed, crisply parted scapegoat in the history of Wall Street, the Mechanical One stood up for himself. The move was wise. If Kenneth D. Lewis also crashes at Bank of America, Mr. Thain’s legacy will very likely be upgraded to that of a tone-deaf bot who was caught up in another one of those big, complicated financial messes that nobody really understands.

headline.main: Parsing Thain: You’re Not Going to Take My Milk Money

abstract: Bank of America’s board should show its chief executive the door, and opinion on the Dow Chemical’s acquisition of Rohm and Haas.
snippet: Bank of America’s board should show its chief executive the door, and opinion on the Dow Chemical’s acquisition of Rohm and Haas.

abstract: In a parting memo to Merrill employees, the former chief executive, John A. Thain, said the $1.2 million office renovation was a mistake.
snippet: In a parting memo to Merrill employees, the former chief executive, John A. Thain, said the $1.2 million office renovation was a mistake.
lead_paragraph: John A. Thain, the former chief executive of Merrill Lynch, defended on Monday his decisions on several fronts as he made his exit from Bank of America. But Mr. Thain sounded a bit contrite about that $35,000 commode.

headline.main: Thain Says He’ll Repay Remodeling Costs
headline.print_headline: Thain Says He’ll Repay Remodeling Costs

abstract: The Masters of the Universe are falling on hard times too, at least by their own gilded standards.
snippet: The Masters of the Universe are falling on hard times too, at least by their own gilded standards.
lead_paragraph: Many ordinary Americans are losing their jobs and savings because of the debacle on Wall Street.

headline.main: The Titans Take It on the Chin
headline.print_headline: The Titans Take It On the Chin

abstract: Andrew Cuomo, New York’s attorney general, said Tuesday that he has subpoenaed John A. Thain, the former Merrill Lynch chief executive, over bonuses paid out by the firm just before it was taken over by Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Andrew Cuomo, New York’s attorney general, said Tuesday that he has subpoenaed John A. Thain, the former Merrill Lynch chief executive, over bonuses paid out by the firm just before it was taken over by Bank of America.

headline.main: Cuomo Subpoenas Thain Over Merrill Bonuses

abstract: The Service Employees International Union, in its most aggressive move yet to criticize the finance industry, has called on Bank of America to remove its chief executive at the bank’s board meeting Wednesday.
snippet: The Service Employees International Union, in its most aggressive move yet to criticize the finance industry, has called on Bank of America to remove its chief executive at the bank’s board meeting Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: The Service Employees International Union, in its most aggressive move yet to criticize the finance industry, has called on Bank of America to remove its chief executive at the bank’s board meeting Wednesday.

headline.main: Union Urges BofA to Oust Chief Executive
